message: I leave Hum-Drum Junk and start down the familiar streets toward my house.
Everything looks the same as it always has, but somehow the air feels different.
Back when Platinum Jail was looming over us, the Old Residential District felt kind of deflated, but now it's brimming with optimism and energy.
Whenever I feel that energy on my skin, my feet start to drag.
Midorijima is moving forward...
...Am I moving forward with it?
I feel like I'm stuck, like I don't belong.
Almost like time has stopped just for me...
...Is it really alright, being stuck like this?
Shouldn't I be trying to change it?
Can I change it? Is there anything I can do?
I failed to save Mink with Scrap.
Because Mink didn't want to keep living.
But...

name: ミンク
message: "You're the one who decides what you do. Or are you such a worm that you can't wipe your own ass without orders?"
...That's right.
I'm the one who decides what I do.
That's why I left the tower without going back for Mink.
I thought that was the path I was supposed to take.
Back then...
Back when Mink was looking out the window in Glitter...
He had to be looking at something.
Maybe it was the homeland he missed so dearly.
Or maybe...
Either way, I think I understand now.
I think I understand how he felt in that moment.
I wanted to know more about Mink.
That hasn't changed.
I want to know what Mink was thinking.
And... how he felt about me.
There's only one way to get those answers.
I won't give up. Not until I know he's gone.
I'm the one who decides what I do.
...It's as simple as that.
A large bird flies overhead.
I look up, feeling a newfound determination fill my chest.
I know Mink is alive somewhere under this vast sky.
And that's why... <k>I'm going to find him.
When I get home, I tell Granny everything.
She's a little surprised at first, but she doesn't object to my plan.
She actually seems to understand. "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," she whispers.
For travel expenses, Granny gives me the savings she's been taking out of my pay every month.
After promising to return one day, and to stay in touch while I'm gone, I leave my home behind.
No matter what, I'm going to find him.
